title: How will education be transformed in the future due to technological advancements? - Quora

response.answer_text: Today, the entire education system is evolving to become more digitized, and there are new and rapidly changing disciplines taught outside the walls of traditional education providers in this knowledge-based society, where technology is continuously exploring new ways in which traditionally disseminated. It is time to understand how practical solutions can optimize the system. Why is traditional education no longer viable? How Is Technology Changing Education! Traditional teaching methods, including textbooks, are quickly becoming inefficient and outdated. Traditional classroom teaching is now led by educational technologists who design and develop curriculum content, according to the CTC (College Transition Collaborative) researchers. Today, traditional education providers are under extreme pressure to bring technology to campus. While many universities and colleges welcome this change, the business model implemented by most institutes is holding it back. University lecturers are permanently employed, their knowledge and expertise are lacking revision, and they cannot develop new courses fast enough, especially technology-related courses. Similarly, we no longer rely on the "next big thing" in education to push us forward and use technology in the classroom. Why tech in education? When students have difficulty learning at a reasonable pace, teaching methods can be changed to meet their needs. Technology's a powerful tool that can support and transform education in many ways. New educational technologies and tools enable everyone to have a piece of good knowledge. New scientific methods include the use of educational software and the display of videos to help students understand a topic through animations and interactive content, making it easier for students to focus on the subject through engaging and attractive videos and slides. In the last ten years, technology has changed the way we work and communicate with each other. But the way we interact outside the classroom has also changed. As our generation changes with technology, we are also changing who we are and what we understand about the power of technology. Indeed, some educators argue that technology can improve the classroom by eliminating the need for a physical class and allowing students to learn where they do their best work. Although it is too early to know the most effective way of teaching, it is vital to keep abreast of innovations in education and see what we can learn from them. Online learning has the potential to improve the quality of education by accelerating learning levels, making use of learning time during school hours, reducing the cost of educational resources, and making use of teachers' time. Online learning, combined with school-based teaching, is often used to take into account student's "different learning styles and enable them to function in a way that is not possible in traditional full-time teaching. In rural areas, where combined and online learning can help teachers and students overcome distances, the use of learning apps is also useful. Blended learning programs include face-to-face and online learning opportunities and the use of social media and social networks. The future: Virtual reality education is on the horizon, and no doubt, it will change the world as we know it. The 21st-century classroom will be a technologically advanced learning space, with VR significantly increasing students "engagement in learning. VR experiences will inspire us to innovate and change our world, not only for the better but also for our future. As more online resources become available to help students learn, education will change. As STEM subjects receive more attention and develop their skills, children will learn skills that did not exist before. Besides, this means the way people learn will change, even if the teacher writes on the blackboard. An example of this is a study on the difficulties students face in some disciplines. It suggests that these challenges will get addressed by combining online learning and distance learning with campus-based education. The time may come when education assessors and teachers will not have to travel to a school location to assess teachers for training but will do so using audiovisual technology. Education remains the driving force behind national development in many countries around the world.

In the modern world, we can view the gradual erasure of borders. This process is related not only to business or politics. Nowadays, almost any person despite their citizenship of physical state can get medical or educational services all around the world thanks to the technology development. To regulate such relationships between a person and international organizations, there are dozens of specialized commissions creating laws and standards. For example, the educational standards claim that students with disabilities should be provided with opportunities to realize their potential. They should participate in education and training on the same basis as students without disabilities and that they are not subject to discrimination. Due to the progress in the IT industry, digital technologies are easily accessible and widespread which allows using them for providing students with new opportunities. Modern eLearning software allows minimizing the effort required for taking a step towards the student with a disability. Web-based solutions help to participate in an education process to the same degree with other students. Here below you can read more about applications that will help you to learn more effectively. Web-Based Service For Distance Learning An example of such tool is Devengo, an integrated cloud-based service for online booking and payment:  Using this software, students can order one of the available educational courses online without leaving home. Also, there’s the possibility to hire a specialist who has the skills required for teaching students with a particular form of disability. Lightweight And Intuitive Video Chat For Online Learning Neat and intuitive web-based chatting applications allow creating online classes that help students with disabilities to communicate with each other and the teacher. Such virtual classrooms allow both learners and teachers from different parts of the world to participate in live classes. Low cost of such an approach to the educational process is one of its main advantages. Students don’t have to worry about travel expenses. All that is required is a laptop or tablet with access to the internet.  An example of a solution for all these issues is XB Chat — an intuitive web-based chatting app with the possibility to hold audio/video and text conversations. Online App For Assessing Individual Academic Performance Special education software helps students with disabilities to reach their potential. Individualized Education Program (IEP) Software simplifies the work with children that have learning issues caused by brain injuries, developmental delays, or intellectual disabilities. Online Staff Performance Management System is an intuitive and easy-to-use performance management tool for educators:  This application provides teachers with better insight into student progress. It allows tracking an educational plan for the student and making changes if needed. Educators can manage individualized education plans better which helps students to reach higher results. Web-Based Solution For Workflow Automation And Compliance With Standards Automated workflow and creation of a single database of all students can reduce the amount of paperwork and improve the efficiency of an educational organization. Web-based software for educators helps following the requirements of education laws and regulations with minimum effort:  It provides a bunch of predefined templates for completing forms. Also, the possibility to import and export data was implemented. All documents created with this module can be saved as a PDF file or printed.
